comment: Very kind professor BUT can be unorganized and assignments can be confusing. PLEASE ASK HIM QUESTIONS. Attendance wasn't mandatory but i recommend attending class and Labs because he can possibly give extra credit. I'd also recommend looking up quizlets for his exams to help understand the material because he didn't give out a study guide.

Take him for behavioral bio! SUPER EASY. For context, I didn't show up to a SINGLE lab and only went to class the first week of school, and ended with an A. Labs are straightforward and instructions are on d2l, so no need to show up. Classes are recorded on d2l from previous semesters. Exams are online with lockdown browser but no camera.

Most of the information taught in lecture is not on the test. The tests do include questions about figures and graphs discussed in class but that's really it. Textbook and lectures feel surface level in comparison to test questions. Very disorganized when it comes to lab and a slow grader. Also, tests use lockdown browser but no webcam.

His lectures were interesting however, his tests do not cover 90% of the lecture material. He does ask a lot about the graphs and figures we discuss in class but most of the test content comes from the textbook. His lecture and even the textbook feel very surface level in comparison to the questions asked on the test.

Good prof that knows his stuff. Lectures mostly pictures on a powerpoint so need to engage in the class to take notes. Tests are in depth and can be difficult, however, they are taken online in lockdown at any point on test day, so you can do it at home. 2 labs at Zoo ATL, and don't have a lab every week. No labs during test week either.

Do not take this professor if you have other options. Attending lectures and taking notes hardly help in studying for exams, exams are mostly based on textbook information and not what he goes over in class. Labs were very confusing and his explanations often leave you more confused rather than making the material make sense.

If you are taking this class for an easy elective, don't bother. Unless you are really into animal behavior, this class is horrible. He makes the tests SO hard even though the info is easy. Barely any labs to actually go to, one semester project, but he doesn't keep up with grading at all. Frustrating. Not worth it. Avoid.

Dr. Tag knows his stuff. Took him for behavioral. He's full of examples, can't get away from cowbirds for some reason. Lectures are clear. Posts his slides and lab materials including a rubric. You'll know exactly what will be on the test in advance. If you follow the rubric on his labs you'll ace them. He's a harsh grader but he follows the rubric like his bible so just stick to that. You have to go to zoo Atlanta for a lab. Overall, I'd definitely take him again.

I took behavioral bio with Tag. He's a cool guy and really funny, so he keeps you interested in the class. He grades pretty hard, so make sure you don't turn in crap or sloppy writing. Labs are tough too. He's very hard to get in touch with through email, though he says he will get back to you, he either doesn't or does very late.

Dr. Tag is awesome. I took his behavioral bio class and the material is extremely interesting, all about animal behaviors. He is a tough grader. Labs are worth 50% of your grade, including a semester project worth 20%, but if you ask for help and spend the appropriate amount if time, you can do well. Overall,I highly recommend Dr Tag and his class.
He was OKAY, he failed me so I don't like him. but overall he is very smart and cares about Biology... Blah!

Like the last person said, you definately have to work for your grade! Grades Lab hard as hell and test get more and more away from just being on ppt slides. He is a nice guy but in my opinion not the best option for a teacher, wouldnt take em again
Great professor! Will make you work for your grade so beware. He is very passionate about what he is teaching and hey he is nice to look at.

his lectures were FAIR, material was well explained and you expect what is on the test. tests are 50 questions multiple choice. Study powerpoints and fill in the gaps with the textbook and you should do fine for lecture. LAB is a whole different story. Takes forever to grade, grades HARSH LIKE A MOFO

He seemed easy at the beginning but his tests gradually got harder becoming less and less "straight from the slides" He is entertaining in class. If you come to him for help, he basically will just be like, "Yeah you were wrong... that sucks." Don't hope to gain extra points somewhere. Procrastinates grade and lecture posting!

Awesome. He is such an interesting teacher who is very passionate. Biology is not my strong suit but he made it worth going to class. Has all notes online, not necessary to go to class. ONLY tests and labs for your grades. No fluff. study hard and you will do well. He is a good teacher who is very willing to help students.
